meanings.definition: A length of thick string or rope made of twisted strands.
meanings.sent1: She tied the package with colorful cords.
meanings.sent2: The sailor used strong cords to secure the boat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the cords, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: The cords of friendship between them never broke, no matter the distance.
meanings.sent5: The cords of the old guitar hummed with memories of past melodies.

meanings.definition: A unit of measure for firewood, equal to 128 cubic feet.
meanings.sent1: Dad ordered three cords of firewood for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack stacked the cords neatly in the shed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the cords of wood were a giant playground.
meanings.sent4: The cords of firewood stood tall like a fortress against the cold.
meanings.sent5: The cords of firewood crackled and popped in the fireplace, warming the room.

meanings.sent1: The computer was connected to the monitor with cords.
meanings.sent2: She unplugged the cords to move the lamp to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent3: The cords seemed to tangle themselves up whenever she wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: The cords of electricity flowed through the house, powering all the devices.
meanings.sent5: The cords of the charger wrapped snugly around the phone, bringing it back to life.
